info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:49PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...SOUTHERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTH CENTRAL FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 248 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Perryopolis, or 10 miles northwest of Connellsville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Spotters also reported golf ball size hail in California PA. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Greensburg, Jeannette, Latrobe, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, McChesneytown-Loyalhanna, Blairsville, Youngwood, Derry, West Newton, Lawson Heights, and New Stanton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
